newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway shares driven by U.S. trend, macroeconomics.
newsitem.headline: Norway shares driven by U.S. trend, macroeconomics.

text.p: Norwegian shares rallied to a record close for the ninth consecutive session on Wednesday buoyed by Wall Street gains and positive macroeconomic factors, dealers said.
The Total index rose 0.43 percent to 919.61 points in heavy trade worth 1.1 billion crowns.
"The market looks very strong," one dealer said. "There is still a lot of liquidity, interest rates are low, inflation is low and New York is setting the trend for us."
Heavy industry shares such as Norsk Hydro and Kvaerner continued to rise, but food-based conglomerate Orkla took a break after soaring for days on the back of a strong interest in consumer stock.
Norsk Hydro, Norway's largest listed company, was the most traded share of the day at 166 million crowns and it rose 0.65 percent to 311 crowns.
Offshore engineering and construction group Kvaerner A share was up more than two percent at 252 crowns.
Orkla A was down 0.7 percent at 441 crowns.
